Language.Sentence: The Shortcut type produces an object that allows catching and processing the shortcut key pressed by user, and then triggers the assigned event.
The order of rendering the object on the page. The objects with identical values of the Hierarchy attribute are rendered in the order they are written in the XML-file of the VDOM application.
Spacing in pixels between the object and the top border of the container, in which the object is situated.
Spacing in pixels between the object and the left border of the container, in which the object is situated.

Libraries.Library:
<script language='javascript' type='text/javascript'>
var SPECIAL_KEYS = {
  27    : 'escape',
  112   : 'f1',
  113   : 'f2',
  114   : 'f3',
  115   : 'f4',
  116   : 'f5',
  117   : 'f6',
  118   : 'f7',
  119   : 'f8',
  120   : 'f9',
  121   : 'f10',
  122   : 'f11',
  123   : 'f12',
  999   : 'sysrq',
  145   : 'scroll',
  19    : 'pause',


  192   : '`',
  189   : '-',
  187   : '=',
  8   : 'backspace',
  45    : 'insert',
  36    : 'home',
  33    : 'pageup',
  144   : 'num',
  111   : '/',
  106   : '*',
  109   : '-',


  9     : 'tab',
  219   : '[',
  221   : ']',
  220   : '\\',
  46    : 'delete',
  35    : 'end',
  34    : 'pagedown',
  103   : '7',
  104   : '8',
  105   : '9',
  107   : '+',

  
  20    : 'caps',
  186   : ';',
  222   : '\'',
  13    : 'enter',
  100   : '4',
  101   : '5',
  102   : '6',
  

  16    : 'shift',
  188   : ',',
  190   : '.',
  191   : '/',
  38    : 'up',
  97    : '1',
  98    : '2',
  99    : '3',
  

  17    : 'ctrl',
  91    : 'super',
  18    : 'alt',
  32    : 'space',
  92    : 'super',
  93    : '???',
  37    : 'left',
  40    : 'down',
  39    : 'right',
  96    : '0',    
  110   : '.'
}


var SHIFT_SYNONYMS = {
  '`'   : '~',
  '1'   : '!',
  '2'   : '@',
  '3'   : '#',
  '4'   : '$',
  '5'   : '%',
  '6'   : '^',
  '7'   : '&',
  '8'   : '*',
  '9'   : '(',
  '0'   : ')',
  '-'   : '_',
  '='   : '+',

  '['   : '{',
  ']'   : '}',
  '\\'  : '|',

  ';'   : ':',
  '\''  : '"',

  ','   : '<',
  '.'   : '>',
  '/'   : '?'
}



function utils() {}
utils.type = function( obj ) {
  if( !obj.constructor ) return typeof( obj )
  
  if( obj.constructor.name )
    return obj.constructor.name

  var type = obj.constructor.toString()
  var i = type.indexOf( ' ' )
  var j = type.indexOf( '(' )
  return type.substring( i+1, j )
}
utils.strip = function( text ) {
  if (!text) return ''
  return text.replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g, '')
}










// -------------------------------------------------------
//    Keydown Event Handler
// -------------------------------------------------------

function KeydownMultiHandler() {
  if( arguments.callee.instance )
    return arguments.callee.instance

  this.handlers = []
  this.initialized = false

  this.init()

  return arguments.callee.instance = this
}

KeydownMultiHandler.onkeydown = function( event ) {
  var handlers = new KeydownMultiHandler().handlers
  var result = true

  // call handlers
  for( var i in handlers ) {
    try {
      var retVal = handlers[i]( event )
      result = result && retVal
    }
    catch( error ) {}
  }

  // stop this event if it was catched
  if( !result ) event.preventDefault()
  
  return result
}

KeydownMultiHandler.prototype.init = function() {
  if( this.initialized ) return
  
  function connect( object ) {
    if( !object ) object = window

    if( object.addEventListener ) {
      object.addEventListener( 'keydown', KeydownMultiHandler.onkeydown, true )
      return true
    }

    if( object.attachEvent ) {
      object.attachEvent( 'onkeydown', KeydownMultiHandler.onkeydown )
      return true
    }

    return false
  }

  // solution for IE
  if( navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer' ) {
    this.initialized = connect( document )
    return
  }

  // solution for normal browsers
  this.initialized = connect( window )

}


KeydownMultiHandler.add = function( handler, thisObj ) {
  if( !handler ) return
  
  function Caller( handler, thisObj ) {
    var wrapper = function( event ) {
      // call in context
      if( thisObj ) 
        return handler.call( thisObj, event )

      // simple call
      return handler( event )
    }

    return wrapper
  }
    
  new KeydownMultiHandler().handlers.push( new Caller(handler, thisObj) )
}







// -------------------------------------------------------
//    Hot Key
// -------------------------------------------------------

function Hotkey( value, action ) {
  this.ctrl   = false
  this.alt  = false
  this.shift  = false
  
  this.key  = ''
  this.action = ''

  if( !value ) return

  // check for event
  if( utils.type(value) == 'KeyboardEvent' )
    this.fillFromHotkey( Hotkey.fromEvent(event) )

  // check, maybe HotKey
  if( utils.type(value) == 'Hotkey' ) 
    this.fillFromHotkey( value )
    
  // check that input is String
  if( utils.type(value) == 'String' ) 
    this.fillFromHotkey( Hotkey.fromString(value) )
  
  this.action = action || ''
}



Hotkey.prototype.fillFromHotkey = function( other ) {
  if( !other ) return
  if( utils.type( other ) != 'Hotkey' ) return

  this.ctrl   = other.ctrl
  this.alt  = other.alt
  this.shift  = other.shift

  this.key  = other.key
  this.action = other.action
}


Hotkey.prototype.toString = function() {
  var array = []
  
  if( this.ctrl )   array.push( 'ctrl' )
  if( this.alt )    array.push( 'alt' )
  if( this.shift )  array.push( 'shift' )

  if( this.key ) {
    key = this.key.toLowerCase()
    if( key != 'ctrl' && key != 'alt' && key != 'shift' )
      array.push( key )
  }

  return array.join( '+' )
}


Hotkey.prototype.synonyms = function() {
  if( !this.key ) return []
  if( !this.shift ) return []
  if( !SHIFT_SYNONYMS.hasOwnProperty( this.key ) ) return []

  var key = SHIFT_SYNONYMS[ this.key ]

  var a = new Hotkey( this )
  a.key = key
  
  var b = new Hotkey( a )
  b.shift = false

  return [ a, b ]
}


Hotkey.prototype.isEqual = function( other ) {
  if( !other ) return false

  if( utils.type(other) != 'Hotkey' )
    other = new Hotkey( other )

  var other_str = other.toString()

  if( this.toString() == other_str )
    return true
  
  var synonyms = this.synonyms()
  for( var i in synonyms )
    if( other_str == synonyms[i].toString() ) return true
  
  return false
}


Hotkey.fromString = function( text ) {
  var result = new Hotkey()

  if( !text ) return result
  if( utils.type(text) != 'String' ) return result

  function set( value ) {
    if( !value ) return
    value = value.toLowerCase()

    switch( value ) {
      case 'ctrl':
        result.ctrl = true
        break

      case 'alt':
        result.alt = true
        break

      case 'shift':
        result.shift = true
        break

      default:
        result.key = value
    }
  }

  var array = text.split( '+' )
  if( text.indexOf( '++' ) > 0) array.push( '+' )

  for( var i in array ) set( array[i] )
  return result
}


Hotkey.fromEvent = function( event ) {
  var result = new Hotkey()
  if( !event ) return result

  if( event.ctrlKey )
    result.ctrl = true

  if( event.altKey )
    result.alt = true

  if( event.shiftKey )
    result.shift = true

  var code = event.keyCode || event.which || event.charCode
  var key = String.fromCharCode( code )

  // this bug catched in Google Chrome
  if( code == 229 ) {
    key = 'u'
  }
  

  if ( SPECIAL_KEYS.hasOwnProperty(code) )
    key = SPECIAL_KEYS[ code ]

  result.key = key.toLowerCase()
  return result
}










function VdomShortcut( id, data ) {
  this.id     = id || ''    // id of hotkey object
  this.data     = data || {}  // data - hotkeys that need to catch
  this.catchkeys  = []

  this.debug    = false     // flag that enable debug mode
}


VdomShortcut.prototype.start = function() {
  for( var key in this.data ) {
    var action = this.data[key]
    this.catchkeys.push( new Hotkey(key, action) )
  }

  KeydownMultiHandler.add( VdomShortcut.onkeydown, this )
}


VdomShortcut.prototype.startDebug = function() {
  this.debug = true
  KeydownMultiHandler.add( VdomShortcut.onkeydown, this ) 
}


VdomShortcut.onkeydown = function( event ) {
  var hotkey = Hotkey.fromEvent( event )
  
  // debug putput
  if( this.debug ) {
    console.log( hotkey.toString() )
    console.log( event )
  }

  for( var i in this.catchkeys ) {
    var key = this.catchkeys[i]
    
    if( hotkey.isEqual(key) ) {
      var args = {
        'action'    : key.action,
        'shortcut'  : key.toString()
      }

      // debug output
      if( this.debug ) {
        console.log( this.id, 'keydown', args )
        return false
      }
      
      // execute event
      execEventBinded( this.id, 'keydown', args )
      return false
    }
  }

  return true
}

</script>
